website_summaries.verdict: Despite some quirks, this one-camera monitor also has some nice features including good picture quality and a budget-friendly price.
pros: Offers a combination of affordability and essential features that includes infrared mode, zoom function, 2-way talk, and sensitive mic
cons: Battery life tends to be disappointing
Owners question the 1,000 ft. range, as signal interruptions at shorter distances have been noted

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Pan/Tilt from monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bummed on this thing. We had an older model which we love. When ordering, I saw that it said it could pan and tilt in the questions section, but alas, it cannot. And the battery life when not plugged in is rubbish. Not only that, our older model had a little hole in the bottom of the camera unit which allowed you to mount it. This one clearly requires some kind of secondary product to facilitate the same feature. It's a hole where something screws in. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Klem

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed with this one
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace our vtech monitor that stopped working abruptly after 9 months of use. Really disappointed with this one. The camera is super low quality so it is almost as if there is a delay in the screening. Doesn't feel like real time, with a lot of motion blur. Also, the camera periodically blacks out for about 30 seconds to a minute. I don't know if that is just because the one we received was damaged, or if all of them would do that. The quality of the vtech camera was SO much better that we are just going to purchase the old monitor we had again with a two year protection plan this time.
customer_reviews.author: Mom_1

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is decent. The battery life is AWFUL. In fact, I always have to keep it plugged in if I am using it. The picture quality is not very good, however I don’t mind that. So if you’re a mom that wants perfect picture quality, I would not recommend this monitor. Very blurry and if he moves his body too much, the camera can’t keep up with the fast motions. The sound is great on it, I will add! If you’re a second-time, third-time, fourth-time and so on mom, and you want to be able to see your baby, but don’t care too much about the video quality this is a great monitor for you!

customer_reviews.title: Invest in something better.

It started to only last up to 30 min off of the charger now the second it’s off it beeps that it’s dying. It gets static a lot and can be quite annoying. Our rooms are not far apart either. I just wish for the price it lasted.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long-term.

I love being woken up at night to the low battery beep when I think it’s plugged in. I am not sure how this unit would qualify to have a 9.5 hour battery life given this information. I assumed that the battery life meant while the unit was in use. I would not purchase this again as it is virtually useless unless continually plugged in.

product_meta.title: Motorola MBP33XL 3.5" Video Baby Monitor with Digital Zoom, Two-Way Audio and Room Temperature Display
product_meta.description:
Style:3.5" Screen - 1 CameraThis Motorola 3.5" Video Baby Monitor enables you to always keep an eye on things. The crystal clear two-way
audio feature allows you to very clearly communicate as if you are in the same room with your little one. Rest
assured that they are always safe and sound with digital zoom and infrared night vision for keeping an eye on
things in very low light levels. The multiple camera viewing with picture-in-picture and auto-switch screen
options allows you to add additional cameras and keep an eye on the entire family in up to 4 rooms of your
home. Motorola 3.5" Video Baby Monitor. Monitor what matters. To extend the battery life of the parent unit,You can enable Power saving mode: Press the MENU button and the menu bar will pop up. Press the LEFT or RIGHT button until Set Video on Timer Icon is highlighted. Press the OK button to confirm. Press the UP or DOWN button to select auto video off after 5 mins, 30 mins or 60 mins if not in charging. Refer user manual for troubleshooting guide.
